div.l: Oure corn̄ is stole men wol vs folis calle
Bothe the wardeyn and our͗e felaws alle
And namly the miller͗e wellaway
Thus pleynth Iohn as he goth bi þe way
Toward the mille and bayard on his hond
The millere syttynge by þe fire he fond
For it was nyȝt and fether myȝt þey not
But for þe loue of god they him be souȝt
Off herberw and of ese for hir peny
The miller͗e seide ageyn yef ther be eny
Suche as it is ȝit shall ye haue your͗e part
Myn hous is streite and ye haue lerned art
Ȝe conne by argumentis make a place
A myle brod of xxᵗⁱ fete of space
Late se now ȝef this place may suffice
Or make it rowme with speche as is your͗e gise
Now symond seide Iohn by seynt Cutberte
Ay is thow mery and that is fayr͗e answert
I haue herd seie men shall of twa thinges
Take suche as he fynt or take suche as he bringes
But specialy y prey the host dere
Gete vs some mete and drynke and make vs cher͗e
And we wolle payen trewly at fulle
With empti hondis men may no hawkis tolle
Lo here our͗e siluer redy for to spende
This miller͗e to þe toun̄ his douȝtir sende
For ale and bred and rosted hem a goos
And bond hir hors it shuld nomor͗e go loos
And in his owne Chaumbre he mad a bed
With shetys and with chalouns fayr͗e spred
Nouȝt from his owne bed x fote or twelue
His dowȝtir had a bed by hir selue
Ryȝt in the same Chaunbre by and by
Hit myȝt not be no bet and cause why
There was no romer herberwe in þe place
They soupen and they speken hem to solace
And dronken euer strong ale atte þe beste
About mydnyȝt wente they to Reste
